p: Chloroquine (CQ), a 4-aminoquinoline approved by the Food and Drug Administration to treat malaria, has long been prescribed prophylactically to pregnant women at risk of exposure to Plasmodium parasites ( Levy et al., 1991). CQ reportedly exhibits antimalarial, anti-inflammatory, and antiviral activities, with in vitro efficacy against several viruses, including CoVs ( Wilde De et al., 2014); however, real-time data concerning its in vivo distribution during viral infection and anti-CoV activity in living animals remains limited.
